oai_dc:dc.dc:title: "Tomorrow You Will be Given an Opportunity to Help Pay Off the Mortgage," news article
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: York, Alvin Cullum, 1887-1964; Clippings (Books, newspapers, etc.); Scrapbooks; Fund raising
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Newspaper clipping requesting donations to pay off the $12,500 mortgage of the farm purchased by the Nashville Rotary Club and presented to Alvin York for his exploits in World War I. It encourages everyone to make a donation to York, declaring him the "greatest hero of the greatest war in the history of the world." It clarifies that York is not requesting this money -- the Rotary Club and Nashville newspapers have organized this project independently to honor York's accomplishments.

Alvin York was one of the most decorated American soldiers in World War I. He was awarded a Medal of Honor and a French Croix de Guerre for taking a German machine gun nest and assisting in the capture of 132 German soldiers. The York property, later to become a state park, was paid for by the Nashville Rotary Club, but it was built in York's hometown of Pall Mall in Fentress County.
